alert.note: Alert for Pickens; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 10:23AM EST until December 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Greenville, Pickens and Spartanburg. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1019 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges continued to show pockets of heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. The Reedy River level was at 9.1 feet which floods spots along the Swamp Rabbit Trail as well as low lying areas in Unity and Cleveland Parks. Other tributaries of the major drainages in the region will flood in spots this morning. This includes but is not limited to the Saluda, Reedy, Enoree and Tyger River basins. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
